intro.description: This cheat sheet will show you how to further define and edit a VTK pipeline file.

item.title: Open the g-Eclipse User perspective
item.description: If you are not already in the g-Eclipse User perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > Other... and select g-Eclipse (User). Alternatively, click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Open the VTK Pipeline Editor
item.description: If you have closed the VTK Pipeline Editor, created in the previous cheatsheet, double-click on your .vtkpipeline file to open it up again. You will see a five page editor, with the Overview page selected. This editor will allow you to further describe your VTK pipeline. Note that only the file location is currently used when reading the VTK Pipeline file during rendering. All other settings will be used in later development.

item.title: Overview Page
item.description: The Overview page that also links to the additional editor pages allows you to edit the main entries, which you have originally filled in with the wizard. If you are satisfied with the content of this page, select the next tab or click on the DataSource link.

item.title: Data Source Page
item.description: On this page, under the Data Source Section, you can change the data file location, and the type of the data. Under the Data Reader Section, you will be able to add the VTK reader class and set its respective parameters. Now select the next tab called Data Processing Page.

item.title: Data Processing Page
item.description: On this page you will be able to change the output format. Now select the next tab called VTK Filter Algorithm Page.

item.title: VTK Filter Algorithm Page
item.description: On this page you will be able to add the filter algorithm classes and their attributes. Now select the last tab called *.vtkpipeline.

item.title: Raw .vtkpipeline Page
item.description: On this page you can see how your pipeline structure looks. You could edit this file by hand but it is recommended you use the editor to make changes in order to keep your file valid at all times.
